trans-unit.source: Item Calculation Groups identify items (in a production BOM) that need to be combined in a separate calculation line.

trans-unit.source: It is only necessary to use Item Calculation Groups if items or work centers in the calculation need to be separately represented.

trans-unit.source: With this function, costing calculation groups can be created.

trans-unit.source: For example, an item’s production BOM contains raw materials, semi-finished materials, and packing materials. In the Item Card, a user enters the RAW item calculation group for the raw materials, SEMI for the semi-finished materials, and PACK for the packaging materials.

trans-unit.source: When a calculation is created for the item, the costs of the raw materials are totaled in the first calculation line, the costs of the semi-finished lines are totaled in the second one, and the costs of the packaging lines are totaled in the third line.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the values for the material costs are correct after calculation, all items included in the production BOM must have a value in the Standard Cost field. The calculation is generally based on the item’s base unit of measure.
